clinical_study.brief_title: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Complicated Grief
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial of Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Complicated Grief

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether cognitive behavioral therapy (CG-CBT) for complicated grief is superior to wait list condition in patients with comorbid complicated grief. To evaluate the effect pre-post changes for patients in the CG-CBT-group will be compared to changes in the wait list group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change between intake (t1) and end of treatment (t2) in complicated grief severity within 5 months. t1= before treatment or wait list begins, t2 = 4 months after t1 (end of treatment, end of waitlist), t3 = follow-up (1.5 years after t2)

secondary_outcome.measure: Symptom Checklist 90 revised (SCL-90R; Subscale General Symptom Index, GSI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change between intake (t1) and end of treatment (t2) in general distress symptoms within 5 months. t1= before treatment or wait list begins, t2 = 4 months after t1 (end of treatment, end of waitlist), t3 = follow-up (1.5 years after t2)

Change between intake (t1) and end of treatment (t2) in number of comorbid psychiatric diagnoses within 5 months; t1= before treatment or wait list begins, t2 = 4 months after t1 (end of treatment, end of waitlist), t3 = follow-up (1.5 years after t2)

intervention.intervention_name: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy for Complicated Grief
intervention.description: Manualized CBT with 25 sessions, once a week. Key elements are exposition and cognitive restructuring.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age complicated grief diagnosis
Exclusion Criteria:
- acute suicidality
